ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Belt of Concordance speedup
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The times in the logfile (last I checked) are only accurate to 1 second.  That gives a maximum possible error of 1.99 seconds.  Most of the tested times
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 4 Apr 2000, Greg Gillan wrote:
>
> Okay, cool, I'll give it a whirl. Just out of curiosity, why don't you /log
> everything, then just parse the times from the log file? Is there some
> inaccuracy associated with this?

The times in the logfile (last I checked) are only accurate
to 1 second. That gives a maximum possible error of 1.99
seconds. Most of the tested times were around 60 seconds, so
a 2 second error translates into a +/- 3% margin of error.
And that's before you take into account error due to lag.

I suppose you could just leave it running for 5-10 minutes,
but that would mean it'd take me several hours to do the 20-30
different tests.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
